response.answer_text: What is traditional technology? There are many answers on Quora. Essentially it is the customary technology of a region or culture handed down for generations before the advent of modern technology. A good example would be the making of the Katana, the famous Japanese sword. There was a specific technique not only developed over centuries, but by individual shops! Could we build a Gothic Cathedral today, for instance? Some things cannot be imitated or outdone by modern methods!

From Google search: Traditional technology is a type of technology that is based on any tradition or culture which is generally transferred from one generation to another generation until it is modified to the new one.Jun 24, 2019
